Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
public class Controller extends Object
Controller class manages the interaction between the game components, menus, and the AI player.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Youssef Tarek

  • Method Details

    • ExitPrompt

      public static void ExitPrompt()

      Displays an exit prompt using JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(Component, Object) and stores the return in an int variable called response.

      If response == 0 then it exits the code by using System.exit(int).

      See Also:
      • showConfirmDialog()

    • getMainMenu

      public static MainMenu getMainMenu()
      Gets the mainMenu instance.
      Returns:
      the static mainMenu object.

    • makeAIMove

      public static void makeAIMove()

      The method used when the player is required to make a move.

      Starts by calling the AIPlayer.makeMove() and stores the return in an int array called aiMove.

      Then calls the method XOBoard.DisableAllButtons() to disable the buttons until the move is registered.

      Then calls the XOBoard.getButtons() method and uses index 0 and index 1 in the aiMove array to get the right button in the 2d array of buttons in XOBoard by using row i and column j to set the text as "X" by using the AbstractButton.setText(String) method.

      Then disables the same button by using the AbstractButton.setEnabled(boolean) method.

      Then enables the buttons again by calling the XOBoard.EnableAllButtons() method.

      Then added one to the NOMoves property in the XOBoard class by using the XOBoard.setNOfMoves(int) method and in side of it, it uses XOBoard.getNOfMoves() and adds one to it.

    • getPlayer

      public static AIPlayer getPlayer()
      Gets the static player object from the Controller.
      Returns:
      player.

    • setPlayer

      public static void setPlayer(AIPlayer player)
